intro: Hieracium vulgatum var. grandiceps, commonly known as the tall hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine, soft hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense, flat-topped clusters, which bloom from June to September. Its leaves are lance-shaped, with serrated edges, and the plant thrives in sunny, disturbed soils such as roadsides and meadows. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
